website_summaries.verdict: A copper-coated steel rod that is easy to drive into the ground, even in winter.
pros: This easy-to-install 4-foot rod comes with a binding clamp to easy attach to wires
The pointed tip is easy to drive into frozen ground
cons: The clamp leaves a good amount of space and may fail to hold a cable in place

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the intended purpose. Just get a length of heavy gauge copper wire and you're good to go. A tip for securing your copper wire to the rod: Run the wire through the clamp as shown in my pic and tighten the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Stronger Than You Think!
customer_reviews.text: While I needed to provide lightening protection for an outdoor WiFi extender, I was apprehensive selecting copper over a stronger metal/alloy. I learned I had no reason to be concerned. I pounded this rod with a 5lb hammer through roots and thick Carolina clay. I went through it all without bending. I was surprised - happily so.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Z

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good conductor
customer_reviews.text: I was able to drive this into the hard ground during winter. Its the ground connection for my ham antenna. Works well and is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: 5port

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The grounding rod works perfectly to ensure my safety when using my backup generator. The length is great so I dont have to bend over to drive it into the ground for enough depth.
customer_reviews.author: hanna banana

customer_reviews.title: Must be a joke
customer_reviews.text: The so called Rod Clamp is useless. The screw tip is flat, The rod is round, it is near impossible to capture a round cable. There si so much space inside the clamp that when you tighten the screw the cable simply rolls out from under the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Dnewt

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: The rod arrived quickly and was sturdy. Although it is a simple product, I have purchased similar in the past that were not very sturdy and bent when placed in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: James S. Wiggs

customer_reviews.title: Copper grounding rod provides an excellent ground for my new generator.
customer_reviews.text: The copper grounding rod was everything that I hoped it would be. Perfect for grounding my new generator. It was packed and shipped professionally, and was received in 2 days as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Good Ground Rod
customer_reviews.text: used this for the ground for my electric fence to keep my dogs from jumping over the fence. it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Kinler

customer_reviews.title: Used to ground exterior COAX cables
customer_reviews.text: This penetrated my soil more easily than I expected. I installed the top with the clamp inside a sealed exterior junction box. It was perfect for my exterior COAX cables.
customer_reviews.author: P. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for this copper grounding rod. Arrived quickly and works perfectly. It was easy to install outside with my antenna and will protect my electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Generator MFGs
customer_reviews.text: Got it in the ground, hope it lasts a long time. Buried in my dual fuel generator manual was the advice to ground your generator.
customer_reviews.author: FD Firefighter 121

customer_reviews.title: Grounding rod
customer_reviews.text: Was much easier than I expected to drive into ground 4 feet, then again, I live near the beach so mostly sand.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to ground my new internet line. Easy to install just hammer it into the ground and attach the ground wire. Nice that it had a sharpened end to get it started and all the hardware to complete the job.
customer_reviews.author: CamaroGirl

customer_reviews.title: Quaity for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect and I enjoy it so much. It is a quality item and so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Franks

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the ground rod to use with an electric generator. The rod was easy to drive into the ground and I had no problems attaching the ground wire.
customer_reviews.author: King of the Hill Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good value; does the job
customer_reviews.text: The grounding rod is substantial and exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Just what I needed to ground my rooftop antenna. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: jeff reichert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Did the job nicely for my electric pet fence.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Sufficed for the Job
customer_reviews.text: This length of Copper Tubing allowed easy mounting of a Ground wire to it and worked.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Empty tube
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to recieve my grounding rods today. But immediately discovered I was given an empty tube with nothing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Dapper

customer_reviews.title: Ground rod for small electronics
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine I used it to ground underground WiFi line from pole and for Satalite dish.
customer_reviews.author: Robb B.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect for grounding my electric fence. Will probably want 1 or 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kacey

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to provide close-in ground points for my cable and Ethernet surge protectors. I installed them as close as possible to the points where cabling enters the house, in order to minimize the ground path length. Long wires act as inductors to impulse currents, like lightning surges, and are ineffective; in my case, a line to connect to the house ground would render my protective devices almost useless. These rods let me minimize the path length and get the most protection possible. The quality and finish are excellent, packaging was safe and secure, and I wouldn't hesitate to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Wright

customer_reviews.title: Easier Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our new portable generator. When I ordered this product, knowing how hard our ground is, I was not expecting it to be easy to install. To my surprise, I was able to hammer it all the way into the ground! The solid copper ground wire attached without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Kessel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to ground a portable generator. It was very easy to pound into the ground and the rod clamp at the top made it easy to connect the grounding wire.
customer_reviews.author: P. MacLearn

customer_reviews.title: Necessary expense
customer_reviews.text: Copper is not cheap, and this product does the grounding of my fence well, needing only one unit for my 300' line.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to ground my electric fence. All parts included.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Ham Radio!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my generator and one for my radio for field day.
customer_reviews.author: Dude McGnarley

product_meta.title: THE CIMPLE CO 4ft Copper Grounding Rod - 3/8" Diameter - Includes Ground Rod Clamp | Great for Electric Fences, Antennas, Satellite Dishes, and Other Grounding Needs
product_meta.description:
Introducing the 4 Foot Grounding Rod with Clamp by THE CIMPLE CO.

This high quality ground rod is designed to ground your antenna, satellite dishes, coaxial lines and other grounding applications. The rod features a copper covered steel construction that delivers superior strength and durability - able to take the necessary pounding that won't bend or break while you're driving it into the ground. It also flaunts optimal electircal dissipation, providing you with a peace of mind against lightening strikes and power surges. For maximized convenience, it comes with a pre-installed binding ground clamp to ensure an outstanding grounding connection, paired with a smooth and easy installation.

General Purpose Applications:

Off-Air Antenna InstallationsSatellite Dish InstallsElectric FencingGrounding WireDirect Grounding for Earthing& more!

Ground Rod Specifications
Diameter: 3/8 inchesLength: 4 FeetClamp IncludedMaterial: CCS

THE CIMPLE COAll of our high quality products are brought to you by our Family owned and operated company.We are located in Utah, "The Beehive State," here in America; where we have become a leading manufacturer and provider of high quality and durable electronic accessories along with OEM parts and replacements.Our products are backed by our amazing warranty and a satisfaction guarantee, including 100% US based customer assistance.
feature_bullets: INCLUDES: One 3/8 Ground Rod (4 feet) and attached binding clamp
FUNCTION: Perfect option for grounding satellite dishes, off-air antenna and electric fence installations
BUILD: This solid, steel reinforced copper grounding rod is sturdy and provides lightning resistant properties for a safe grounding solution
EASY TO INSTALL: Strong enough to pound into the ground and comes complete with a preinstalled electrical grounding rod clamp for seamless integration with your wires
QUALITY ASSURANCE: Grounding rod with clamp includes a US manufacturers warranty
